Pre-Game Insights: Germany bid to take another step closer to the quarter-finals when they meet Bosnia-Herzegovina.
Germany have taken four points from their first six in League A Group 3, while Bosnia-Herzegovina sit third and are still searching for their maiden victory in this year's tournament.
Bosnia-Herzegovina have not beaten Germany as an independent nation, last losing 3-1 in a 2010 friendly.
Bosnia-Herzegovina's current third-placed ranking would give them the safety net of a relegation/promotion playoff, but they have only beaten Hungary on goal difference.
Germany are without several key players due to injuries, including Kai Havertz, Jamal Musiala, David Raum, Benjamin Henrichs, and Robin Koch.
